title: Problems in recognizing Bash 4.3
body:
Hi,
thank you for the work! I have the problem that my bash 4.3 is not recognized. The problem seems to come that my OS (openSUSE 42.2 (x86_64), VERSION = 42.2, CODENAME = Malachite) writes the string **version** capitalized (**V**ersion instead of **v**ersion):

bash -version | head -1
GNU bash, Version 4.3.42(1)-release (x86_64-suse-linux-gnu)


I experienced it in vs. 0.1.2 (installed by the root, not me) but the recent change in 0.1.3 still seems to have the same problem:
bash -version | head -1 | perl -lane 'if ($_=~/version\s+4\.(\d+)/){if($1>=3){print 1}else{print 0}}else{print 0}'
0

Thanks!
Holger

title: Problems creating java memory parameter
body:
Hi,
I run into another problem: 
After the fastq, the trimming section starts with an error: 
> :INFO: trimming
> Invalid maximum heap size: -Xmx-18g
> 
Indeed, in muvac, the creation of the memory parameter in row 1225  is
> memory=$(script -e -q -c "stty rows 1000; top -b -n 1" /dev/null | grep 'KiB Mem' | perl -lane '$_=~/(\d+)\D+(\d+)\D+(\d+)/; printf("%d",($1-$3)/1024/1024)')

so that on my OS (openSUSE 42.2 (x86_64), VERSION = 42.2, CODENAME = Malachite) 
the parameter memory becomes _-18_ and later on _-Xmx-18g_ instead of _18_  and later on _-Xmx18g_ causing an error.

Thanks again!
Holger

title: Segemehl fails
body:
Unfortunately, I run into another problem, where segemehl failed. here is the log file:
[170614test2.log.txt](https://github.com/koriege/muvac/files/1077760/170614test2.log.txt)

If you like you can send me two fastq files that previously run in your hands in order to exclude any problems due to the input data.

Thanks again!
Best, Holger
